options.name: -b
tip: filter byte columns from the input source

options.name: -d
tip:
U: -d|--delimiter <DELIM>
specify the delimiter character that separates fields in the input source.
Defaults to Tab.

options.name: -w
options.tip: Use any number of whitespace (Space, Tab) to separate fields in the input source (FreeBSD extension).

options.name: -f
tip: filter field columns from the input source

options.name: --complement
options.tip: invert the filter - instead of displaying only the filtered columns, display all but those columns

options.name: -s
options.tip: in field mode, only print lines which contain the delimiter

options.name: -z
options.tip: instead of filtering columns based on line, filter columns based on \0 (NULL character)

options.name: --output-delimiter
tip: in field mode, replace the delimiter in output lines with this option's argument

description: Print specified byte or field columns from each line of stdin or the input files.
